title: Income inequality and the oil resource curse. (arXiv:2401.04046v1 [econ.GN])
abstract: Surprisingly, there has been little research conducted about the cross-country relationship between oil dependence/abundance and income inequality. At the same time, there is some tentative evidence suggesting that oil rich nations tend to under-report data on income inequality, which can potentially influence the estimated empirical relationships between oil richness and income inequality. In this paper we contribute to the literature in a twofold manner. First, we explore in depth the empirical relationship between oil and income inequality by making use of the Standardized World Income Inequality Database; the most comprehensive dataset on income inequality providing comparable data for the broadest set of country-year observations. Second, this is the first study to our knowledge that adopts an empirical framework to examine whether oil rich nations tend to under-report data on income inequality and the possible implications thereof. translated_title: 收入不平等与石油资源诅咒
translated_abstract: 令人惊讶的是，关于石油依赖/丰富与收入不平等的跨国关系的研究很少。同时，有一些初步证据表明，石油富裕国家倾向于低估收入不平等的数据，这可能会影响估计的实证关系。在这篇论文中，我们以两个方面为文献做出贡献。首先，我们利用标准化世界收入不平等数据库，对石油和收入不平等之间的实证关系进行了深入探讨；这是提供最全面的收入不平等数据的数据集，可对最广泛的国家年份观察进行比较。其次，据我们所知，这是第一项采用实证框架来研究石油富裕国家是否倾向于低估收入不平等数据及其可能的影响的研究。我们采用Heckman选择模型进行验证。
tldr: 鲜有关于石油依赖/丰富与收入不平等的跨国关系的研究，本文首次深入探讨了两者之间的实证关系，并考察了石油富裕国家是否倾向于低估收入不平等数据的可能影响。
en_tdlr: There is little research on the relationship between oil dependence/abundance and income inequality. This study explores this relationship in depth and investigates the possible influence of under-reporting income inequality data in oil-rich nations.
